channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [THRIFT-1824] many compile warning, becase Thread.h includes config.h
item.description:
many compile warning, becase Thread.h includes config.h

#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
//#include <config.h> // fix: commented out it
#endif
item.environment:
2.6.32.43 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
automake (GNU automake) 1.9.6
autoconf (GNU Autoconf) 2.59
autoheader (GNU Autoconf) 2.59
item.summary: many compile warning, becase Thread.h includes config.h

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

../../../third-party/thrift/include/thrift/config.h:327:1: warning: this is the location of the previous definition

I think we need a
/usr/include/thrift/thrift-config.h
containing all config.h stuff.

What about that?

Anybody very familiar with that autotools stuff?
We need a patch...
;-r

I have seen other comments (don't recall where) mentioning that naming the file "config.h" causes problems elsewhere, specifically when interacting with python via C++. Calling it thrift/config.h would probably be good enough, but going with a "smurfy" naming convention of thrift/thrift-config.h would definitely resolve the core issue.

Sadly, I'm not the autotools person for the job.

Maybe config.h should be removed from include directory, we should not
include config.h in public header files.

2013/1/8 Ben Craig (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

–
Hadoop Forum: http://www.hadoopor.com
Open mooon: http://code.google.com/p/mooom

configure.ac line 577 AC_CONFIG_HEADERS(config.h:config.hin) is what generates the config.h file using autoheader.

This is a known problem for projects using autotools and has come up before in THRIFT-705 where we went with the addition of ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H. There are 26 checks for this header in the lib/

{cpp,c_glib,php}

code.

Attached is a patch which will wrap our config.h with #ifndef CONFIG_H to guard against duplicate definitions and also still allow people who would not have config.h to compile properly.

Integrated in Thrift #662 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift/662/)
THRIFT-1824:many compile warning, becase Thread.h includes config.h (Revision 240df17f85c8086bc5f9f17c28ce9e0936f65316)

Result = FAILURE
